metadata.name: Global Tariff Briefing
metadata.audience: NYT colleagues tracking tariffs and trade policy globally

all.headline: UK Set to Slash Bond Sales by 20% And Add to Gilt Tailwinds
all.description: The UK is expected to slash gilt sales in the coming year, a rare piece of good news for bond investors concerned about the country’s strained finances.

all.headline: S&P 500 Faces February Loss as Europe, Asia Rally: Markets Wrap
all.description: The S&P 500 is set for a monthly loss after a whirlwind February marked by twin fears of a bubble in the artificial-intelligence trade and of the technology’s disruptive power. Ten-year Treasury y

all.headline: Treasuries Are Still the Place to Be in a Turbulent World
all.description: US government debt posts its biggest monthly gain in a year amid AI angst.

all.headline: Oil Gains With More Nuclear Talks Planned as US Forces Gather
all.description: Oil rose as the US and Iran agreed to more nuclear talks next week, while the deployment of American forces in the Middle East kept the market on edge.

all.headline: Novo Nordisk’s Torrid Week Erases Last of Wegovy-Fueled Gains
all.description: The weight loss-fueled gains of Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk A/S are officially a thing of the past.

all.headline: EU Forges Ahead With Mercosur Trade Deal in ‘Provisional’ Step
all.description: The European Union will provisionally apply its trade deal with the Mercosur group of South American countries, overriding concern from some lawmakers who have sent the deal for a test at the bloc’s t

all.headline: Deutsche Bank’s Epstein Files Throw Family Offices Into the Open
all.description: Among the trove of material released as part of the US government’s Jeffrey Epstein investigation is a stash of Deutsche Bank AG files that shed light on one of global finance’s most private corners.

all.headline: Fast Money Funds Ditch US Stocks For Safe Havens as Jitters Rise
all.description: The latest bout of volatility lashing US stocks has driven some quantitative investment managers completely out of equities and into less risky assets.

all.headline: Nvidia Looks Like a Value Stock Even as Earnings Scream Growth
all.description: Nvidia Corp. has one of the strongest growth stories in the market after posting blowout earnings on Wednesday. So why is it trading at a level that looks like a value stock?

all.headline: Gold Steadies as US and Iran Agree to Extend Nuclear Talks
all.description: Gold steadied after the US and Iran agreed on further nuclear talks, while the American military build-up in the Middle East kept markets on edge about the potential for conflict.

all.headline: Paramount set for $111bn Warner Bros takeover after Netflix drops bid
all.description: Netflix's decision to back down from the bidding war clears the path for Paramount to win the takeover battle.

all.headline: Jack Dorsey's Block cuts thousands of jobs as it embraces AI
all.description: The Twitter co-founder says he believes the majority of firms will make similar changes "within the next year."

all.headline: 'I was on Instagram all day' - woman tells landmark trial
all.description: The young woman, who accuses Meta and Google of making addictive social media platforms, has been speaking in court.

all.headline: Dyson settles forced labour suit in landmark UK case
all.description: Migrant workers alleged they were subjected to abusive treatment in a Malaysian factory for Dyson.

all.headline: Burger King rolls out AI headsets that track employee 'friendliness'
all.description: The fast-food chain is testing OpenAI-powered headsets that monitor staff interactions with customers.

all.headline: Why you can't get a signal at festivals and sports matches
all.description: Connecting up music and sports events to the internet is a massive undertaking.

all.headline: Anthropic boss rejects Pentagon demand to drop AI safeguards
all.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth previously threatened to remove the firm from the department's supply chain.

all.headline: Mandelson referred to EU anti-fraud agency over Epstein emails
all.description: The European Commission says it is assessing whether the peer breached its code of conduct while its trade envoy.

all.headline: Nearly a million 16-24 year-olds not working or in education
all.description: People at the start of their careers are particularly affected by the UK's weak job market.

all.headline: World Economic Forum boss quits after review of Epstein links
all.description: Brende acknowledged communications with Epstein but said he was "completely unaware" of his past criminal activity.

all.headline: What we know after latest escalation in Pakistan-Afghanistan tensions
all.description: Bombings by Pakistan are the most significant development in tensions between the two neighbours - though the physical impact remains unclear.

all.headline: Hillary Clinton tells House panel she 'had no idea' of Epstein's crimes
all.description: The ex-secretary of state called for President Trump to be questioned under oath about his past association with the sex offender.

all.headline: Why Trump means the Cuban Revolution faces its biggest threat yet
all.description: Will a worsening internal crisis create the conditions for the Cuban Revolution to unravel from within?

all.headline: Epstein tried to buy a palace in Morocco days before his arrest in 2019
all.description: The disgraced financier was in talks to buy luxury abode Bin Ennakhi - but the purchase was never completed.

all.headline: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
all.description: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

all.headline: Drone jammed near French aircraft carrier was probably Russian, says Sweden
all.description: Sweden's defence minister says there is likely a "strong link" between the drone and a Russian naval vessel in the area.

all.headline: American citizen among those killed in Cuba boat shooting, US official says
all.description: Cuba has accused those on board of planning "an infiltration with terrorist aims” and firing first.

all.headline: Danish PM calls snap election with Greenland issue centre-stage
all.description: The issue of Greenland, which Donald Trump wants to annex, is likely to dominate the election campaign.

all.description: The accord is controversial because it hasn’t yet been officially blessed by the European Parliament.

all.headline: From plumber to parliament, Hannah Spencer is Britain’s newest MP
all.description: Gorton and Denton's new rep has railed against "posh boys" in Westminster — and shows the Greens leaning into cost-of-living messaging.

all.headline: ‘It’s clearly fake’: Olympic hockey star disavows AI-generated White House video
all.description: "It's not my voice, not my lips moving," he said.

all.headline: Les ambassadeurs américains en Europe n’ont d’yeux que pour Trump
all.description: Les ambassadeurs américains apportent à l'UE un nouveau style de diplomatie plus brusque et plus conflictuel.

all.headline: Zack Polanski’s populist pitch pays off in Gorton and Denton
all.description: The left-wingers promised to take on both Keir Starmer and Nigel Farage — but have faced claims of stoking division.

all.headline: Antisemitismus-Debatte nach der Berlinale und AfD-Teilerfolg
all.description: PRÄSENTIERT VON ROCHE DEUTSCHLAND.

all.headline: Greens storm Gorton and Denton by-election — as Labour slumps to third
all.description: Hannah Spencer will be the party's latest MP after winning Greater Manchester vote  from the left.

all.headline: ‘You’ll have to ask my husband:’ House Republicans say Hillary Clinton punted questions on Epstein
all.description: The former secretary of State testified for roughly six hours, paving the way for Friday’s scheduled grilling of former President Bill Clinton.

all.headline: Greens push Merz to probe Germany’s possible Epstein links
all.description: Berlin politics haven't been roiled by the Epstein files, but Green party leaders say possible domestic ties still need urgent investigation.

all.headline: It’s time for the first AI member of the European Parliament
all.description: The machines are rising in other parliaments, so surely an AI MEP is next on the list.
